comment: Full bodied fruity, vanilla, and smoke, creamy, oak flavor

Letting this sit for 6 months in a 7/8th full bottle improved it immensely.
The turpentine and astringent notes from the first tasting are gone.
This is a subtle and delicate whiskey. The honey and floral notes on the nose are complemented now by some cereal grains, the palate is silky, oily and coating with malt and heather, the finish is long, smokey and warming.

After trying the regular 12 year in a sparsely stocked hotel bar. I went searching for a bottle of 12 year Dewar's.    All I could find was this 18 year old.

Upon first blush... It wasn't the light touch 12 year old I was looking for and I was disappointed.  

But eventually I came to appreciate for what it is.  A superb richer blend full of nuance and flavor.
Very smooth taste with very little burn whatsoever. Drink it neat. Hint of vanilla
Slightly sweeter than Dewar’s white label.
One of the best blended scotches I’ve had except I am a Chivas man.
This is a beautiful scotch. Definitely worth picking up. Sure to be a crowd pleasure.
Mild nose, pretty light but not too complex. A smooth drinking whisky, not much going on apart from that.

The alcohol and turpentine mostly overpower the delicate honey and floral notes on the nose, smooth, rich, oily malt on the palate, the finish is a bit rough with turpentine and astringent notes. I hope this improves over time.
